Brooklyn Historical Society
Donald P. Fina papers
Fina, Donald P.
ARC.056
1.9 Linear Feet in four folders and one oversize scrapbook.
1917-1950 1917-1919 The Donald P. Fina papers span the period 1917 to 1950, though the bulk of the materials date from the period 1917 to 1919. Materials include official documentation pertaining to Fina's military service in the United States Army during World War I, as well as private correspondence between Fina and family members and friends while he was stationed overseas. Post-war material includes documentation regarding Fina's role in veteran affairs, particularly his involvement with the Survivors of Company L; his contribution to Franklin D. Roosevelt's presidential campaign as president of the Roosevelt League; his contribution to state and local politics in Wisconsin; his work as a songwriter, including sheet music and lyrics; and further private correspondence. There are also six photographs, one of which, dating from February 1933, is of former New York governor Al Smith and seems to have been signed and made out to Fina by Smith himself. A0131 Scrapbook ARC.056 1 of 1
Scope and Contents
The Donald P. Fina papers span the period 1917 to 1950, though the bulk of the materials date from the period 1917 to 1919. Materials include official documentation pertaining to Fina's military service in the United States Army during World War I, as well as private correspondence between Fina and family members and friends while he was stationed overseas. Post-war material includes documentation regarding Fina's role in veteran affairs, particularly his involvement with the Survivors of Company L; his contribution to Franklin D. Roosevelt's presidential campaign as president of the Roosevelt League; his contribution to state and local politics in Wisconsin; his work as a songwriter, including sheet music and lyrics; and further private correspondence. There are also six photographs, one of which, dating from February 1933, is of former New York governor Al Smith and seems to have been signed and made out to Fina by Smith himself. There are also two undated and signed copy photographs of Hollywood actors Jane Russell and Don Ameche, a portrait of Margaret Fina (circa 1919), a portrait of Joseph Lamb Jr. (1917), and an undated photograph of Fina himself. Finally, the collection also includes two scrapbooks documenting the activities of the 106th Regiment of Brooklyn, the events of World War I, life in Brooklyn and New York City, politics and culture, the activities of the Roosevelt League of America, and other matters. One of the scrapbooks is oversized and is housed separately from the rest of the collection.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date (if known); Donald P. Fina papers, ARC.056, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
Conditions Governing Access
Open to researchers without restriction.
Biographical Note
Donald P. Fina lived in Brooklyn as a child. During World War I, he served in the United States Army in Company L of the 106th Regiment of Brooklyn. After completing his service, he moved to Wisconsin in 1919, where he was President of the Roosevelt League, a subdivision of the Democratic National Committee's Club Division. Fina was also active in state and local politics in Wisconsin, and was also a songwriter.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Gift of Donald P. Fina, 1952 and 1953.
Conditions Governing Use
Reproduction rights for photographs have not been evaluated. Please consult library staff for more information.
Processing Information
Minimally processed to the collection level.
The collection combines the accessions 1977.152 and V1997.015.
Photographs of Margaret Fina and Joseph Lamb Jr. added to the collection by John Zarrillo in March 2017.
